pageContext.claim: “56% of registered voters tell Gallup that they are better off than they were 4 years ago (under Obama/Biden), while only 32% said they were worse off." Highest number on satisfaction yet recorded, by far.
pageContext.analysis: Trump touts a Gallup poll that said 56 percent of Americans said they were better off than 2016. That's a good result but he leaves out the other finding of the poll -- that 56 percent of Americans also believe Trump “does not deserve to be reelected." In other words, Americans don't give Trump credit for their economic well-being.
